than if each bird flew alone. Birds have learned that they can reach their destination more quickly and with less energy expended when they fly together in formation. The same is true for teams. Teams that share a common direction and goal will get to their destination quicker."

9/9 Read more about the lessons from Sri Lanka‚Äôs collapse in Ranking Member @johnboozman‚Äôs opinion piece in @agripulse last month: 

https://www.agri-pulse.com/articles/18135-opinion-sri-lanka-a-cautionary-tale

8/9 We should help the people of Sri Lanka, but we need to heed the lesson of their government‚Äôs failures before it is too late. Policies that do not take crop health & yields into consideration should be off the table.

7/9 Individually, none of these proposals are as dramatic as Sri Lanka‚Äôs organic-only policy. But when taken collectively, they threaten our ability to continue to produce the world‚Äôs safest, most abundant, and most affordable food supply.

6/9 Want some examples? Here you go:
- Has repeatedly threatened to take vital crop protection tools away
- His unrealistic conservation goals will take large swaths of working land out of commission
- Input costs at record highs under his watch

5/9 Here is where we find ourselves. At a time when fertilizer prices are sky high, the Biden admin is purchasing it for Sri Lankan farmers who were failed by their leadership‚Äôs shortsighted decisions, while at the same time, pursuing policies that could put us on the same path.

4/9 Prior to this dramatic policy change, Sri Lanka had achieved upper-middle-income nation status. The country went from being self-sufficient for most dietary staples to needing the international community‚Äôs humanitarian aid to feed its population.

3/9 But, why is $40 million in cash to buy fertilizer part of the deal? Well, an ill-advised ban on the importation & use of synthetic fertilizers & conventional pesticides largely led to the nation‚Äôs massive food shortages.
2/9 More than 6 million people ‚Äî close to a third of Sri Lanka‚Äôs population ‚Äî are currently facing food insecurity. @USAID is rightfully stepping in to provide much-needed humanitarian aid.
